message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CR 

The paper deals with the causal Markov condition (CMC) and its generalization for any kind of observations on which independence is defined via an arbitrary submodular information measure. This involves the study of causal inference and information theory, which are relevant to several subfields of computer science. Specifically, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely category as it deals with the study of information measures and their properties. cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely categories as causal inference is a key topic in these fields. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is relevant as the paper discusses computable alternatives to Kolmogorov complexity. Finally, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is a possible category as submodular functions have applications in cryptography.
